item.description:
Let's do it again this time with lots of snow on the ground.

We'll explore the trails throughout the park which are wonderful for winter snow sport activities.
After our jaunt in and around the Park we'll head to Bratskellar Pub on Rt. 1 for Pizza & Beers.

Odiorne Point State Park offers one of the most beautiful natural settings along New Hampshire's 18-mile coastline. Within the 135-acre seaside park, visitors can enjoy miles of walking trails.

While the park is an ideal location for seaside outdoor recreation, the property is also renowned for its diverse natural history. Seven distinct natural habitats can be visited in a leisurely hour's walk. Although the spectacular rocky shore is the most popular part of Odiorne, the woodlands, uplands, salt marsh, freshwater and salt ponds, and sandy beach combine to create one of the region's most diverse nature walk areas.

NOTE: The wooden bridge on Rt. 1A is closed while it is being repaired. You'll need to take the detour onto Bracket Rd. if you are coming from Portsmouth. Right on Bracket then left onto Wallis Sands. When you reach Rt 1A "at Wallis Sands Beach" turn Left.

Detour Map Bracket Rd. to Wallis Rd.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the Parking Lot in front of the Science & Nature Center
item.name: Cross Country or Snow Shoeing at Odiorne State Park Rye NH
